sentences.sContent: She treats me like one of the family.
sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer
sentences.sCn: 经过处理可用作肥料的污水

sentences.sContent: Let's go out for lunch─ my treat (= I will pay) .
sentences.sCn: 咱们到外面去吃午餐，我请客。

sentences.sContent: ...the way you would treat high blood pressure or a vitamin deficiency...
...treat pleasure and joy as the enemies of competence and responsibility...
...tourists from both home and abroad treat this ancient city as a paradise of love and romance...
...Not only is this a boring and awful way to treat children...
...Tradition has it that an ancient Chinese emperor discovered the tea five thousand years ago and used it to treat illnesses...
...A plate of cut-up vegetables just doesn’t pack the same emotional a cupcake and not an apple as an after-school treat today...
...We treat them as objects whose appearance and achievements are something we can be proud of...
...But prevention is cheaper in the long run than having to treat the diseases...

phrases.pCn: 不招待就使坏（指万圣节孩子们挨家逐户要糖果等礼物，如不遂愿便恶作剧一番的风俗）
各付己帐；各自付帐的聚餐或娱乐活动

trans.tranOther: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way
something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it
